Author: ca333#0118
Content:
We have some great news - our team is working on the Antara Gaming SDK: the result is going to be an easy to use "Komodo Blockchain Game SDK" and the first of its kind! @ Komodo Community: feel free to propose icon/logo ideas. You can follow our progress on https://github.com/komodoplatform/antara-gaming-sdk 

cc: @Slyris @naezith

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: What kind of games out of interest?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: any type

Author: ca333#0118
Content: yea - there won't be any limitations @hyperDEX (:

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
it will be a dual layer framework/lib - gaming layer and blockchain layer (NSPV and libCC) 
We will provide a reference implementation (howto/tutorial) with a simple game that interacts with the blockchain. We believe that providing game devs high level blockchain functionality access will result in pretty fancy games as they can literally attach a game to blockchain just by utilizing the bc_interface layer in the Komodo Gaming SDK....

Author: ca333#0118
Content: (not having to mess around with the blockchain aspect since this new KMD SDK takes that part over)

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Sounds cool  but how will it differentiate from say CHIPS + BET + PANGEA?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: This SDK will not only provide the blockchain_interface layer - the 2nd essential part is the gaming layer (that is particularily the **UI/gfx layer** - but not limited to this) - which provides devs a basic game skeleton with the game loop, input/output functions, drawing functionality, audio interface, etc. - lets say someone wants to build a fancy 2 player PacMan GUI game that stores gameplay records/highscores, etc. to the blockchain: Komodos new Gamign SDK will even offer a command like `antara_sdk create SFML pacman` (just a pseudo example) which would provide you a folder `pacman` with ALL required SFML libs/bindings, the games main function (gameloop,...) etc. Devs would be able to just start building their game by adding the required assets, game logic, blockchain interaction calls, etc. and voila!

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Cool but where is data stored?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: Depends on the game and also on the type of data - it could be stored into the blockchain just with a simple TX, it could also utilize CC technology for more complex blockchain interaction with specific enforcements, validations, triggers, etc. The technical possibilities are pretty much "unlimited". We would "only" have to respect Moore's Law - means underlying infrastructure, (blockchain) tech stack and resources do limit things to a certain degree.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: some private contract could be under nda for the duration, but VC investment is not under nda as one of the things a VC investment brings to the table is credibility. which you cant get if it is kept a secret

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://magazine.startus.cc/non-disclosure-agreement/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ```VC firms are in the business of sharing information with their portfolio companies. Often individual members of the firm have a fiduciary duty to disclose information in their capacity as portfolio company directors. An NDA could exacerbate unnecessary conflicting disclosure requirements.```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the NDA in the VC process is more about protecting the company IP from being disclosed and not about VC participation.
